semantic_title: Accurate Reporting Requirements for ICD-10-CM Diagnosis Codes
section_path: Section IV > C. Accurate reporting of ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes

content.full_text: For accurate reporting of ICD-10-CM diagnosis codes, the documentation should describe the patient's condition, using terminology which includes specific diagnoses as well as symptoms, problems, or reasons for the encounter. There are ICD-10-CM codes to describe all of these. (Evidence: pg no: 113, L43-L44)
content.summary: Establishes documentation requirements for accurate ICD-10-CM coding, emphasizing comprehensive terminology usage (Evidence: pg no: 113, L43-L44)
key_concepts: Documentation must describe patient's condition accurately (Evidence: pg no: 113, L43-L44)
Terminology should include specific diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 113, L44)
Must include symptoms, problems, or reasons for encounter (Evidence: pg no: 113, L44)
ICD-10-CM has codes for all these elements (Evidence: pg no: 113, L44)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Documentation should describe patient's condition using appropriate terminology (Evidence: pg no: 113, L43-L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: Accurate coding requires comprehensive documentation that includes all relevant clinical information (Evidence: pg no: 113, L43-L44)

workflow_steps: Step 3: Identify symptoms and problems documented
